text: The Englishman at the Moulin Rouge is a late 19th century painting by French artist Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec. Done in oil on cardboard, the work depicts British artist William T. Warrener - a close friend of Lautrec - and two women at the famous Moulin Rouge in Paris. The painting served as a preparatory study for a color lithograph of 1892, and is currently in the collection of the Metropolitan Museum of Art. == References == Category:1892 paintings Category:Paintings of the Metropolitan Museum of Art Category:Paintings by Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec
title: The Englishman at the Moulin Rouge
